column4: is there a way to search for repositories from cli?  ie, i'm looking for a timer applet, how do i search for all the timers out there from cl?
apt-cache search timer
i don't think that's possible
yes it does, i'm talking about cli though
i don't know, but you could easily write a script that calls all the programs you want in a row.
i can't, someone else can/has I'm sure

sure you can, it's a matter of making a text file that says #!/bin/bash on the first line, and on the lines that follow contains the names of the programs you want to run. put it in /usr/local/bin and make it executable.
yes i'm familiar with bash...   i mean getting each program sectioned out on one screen
and truncating the information i don't want to see.
i've searched a bit, but can't see a program like that
maybe you know this answer..   how would i truncate the output of, say,  uptime..   so it only shows the days it's been up ?
not the user or load averages
that'd be a good first step..
uptime | awk ' { print $3 } '
if you want to build this yourself, i think the most useful commands you should keep in mind are awk, head, tail and cut
what if i only want to show the top 5 processes in top?
right..   still haven't gotten savvy with awk or operators
i think i'd be fine with a command like "summary"  that just gives me a snapshot of each thing i want to see, not realtime, for now
top is not really well suited to that, but if you want to show the top 5 processes in "ps aux", then do ps aux --sort -%cpu | head -n 5
